Version {me:iati-version(@version)} of the IATI Standard is no longer supported. Please use other versions.
The activity identifier should begin with the organisation identifier of the reporting organisation (or a previous version included in the other-identifier element).
The activity identifier must not occur multiple times in the dataset.
The activity identifier's prefix and suffix should be separated by a hyphen e.g. XM-DAC-2222
Test (Xpath): $iati-version = '2.03' and not(some $id in (../reporting-org/@ref, ../other-identifier[@type='B1']/@ref) satisfies matches(., functx:escape-for-regex($id) || '-.+'))

Message: The activity identifier must not be the same as the organisation identifier of the reporting organisation.
The identifier should not start or end with spaces or newlines.
The identifier must not contain any of the symbols /, &, | or ?.
The identifier should not start or end with spaces or newlines.

When reporting sectors at transaction level, it is recommended that if a publisher uses a non-DAC classification system or systems, these should be used in addition to DAC 5-digit codes.
The activity should also have a region using the OECD DAC region vocabulary.
The activity should also have a policy-marker using the OECD DAC vocabulary.
The activity should also contain a code from the DAC Type of Aid Vocabulary.
Each selected default-aid-type vocabulary should only be used once for each activity.
Test (Xpath): count(default-aid-type[@vocabulary=('1','') or not(@vocabulary)]) > 1 or (some $v in (default-aid-type/@vocabulary[. != ('1', '')]) satisfies count(default-aid-type[@vocabulary=$v]) > 1)

Message: The transaction should also contain a code from the DAC Type of Aid Vocabulary.
Each selected aid-type vocabulary should only be used once for each transaction.
Test (Xpath): count(aid-type[@vocabulary=('1','') or not(@vocabulary)]) > 1 or (some $v in (aid-type/@vocabulary[. != ('1', '')]) satisfies count(aid-type[@vocabulary=$v]) > 1)

Message: The last-updated-datetime of the activity must not be in the future.
Test (Xpath): @last-updated-datetime and @last-updated-datetime castable as xs:dateTime and xs:dateTime(@last-updated-datetime) gt $now

Message: The planned start date must be before the planned end date.
Test (Xpath): activity-date[@type='1']/@iso-date and activity-date[@type='1']/@iso-date castable as xs:date and activity-date[@type='3']/@iso-date and activity-date[@type='3']/@iso-date castable as xs:date and xs:date(activity-date[@type='1']/@iso-date) gt xs:date(activity-date[@type='3']/@iso-date)

Message: The actual start date must be before the actual end date.
Test (Xpath): activity-date[@type='2']/@iso-date and activity-date[@type='2']/@iso-date castable as xs:date and activity-date[@type='4']/@iso-date and activity-date[@type='4']/@iso-date castable as xs:date and xs:date(activity-date[@type='2']/@iso-date) gt xs:date(activity-date[@type='4']/@iso-date)

Message: The actual start date of the activity must not be in the future.
Test (Xpath): activity-date[@type='2']/@iso-date and activity-date[@type='2']/@iso-date castable as xs:date and xs:date(activity-date[@type='2']/@iso-date) gt xs:date($now)

Message: The actual end date of the activity must not be in the future.
Test (Xpath): activity-date[@type='4']/@iso-date and activity-date[@type='4']/@iso-date castable as xs:date and xs:date(activity-date[@type='4']/@iso-date) gt xs:date($now)

Message: The transaction date must not be in the future.
Test (Xpath): transaction-date/@iso-date and transaction-date/@iso-date castable as xs:date and xs:date(transaction-date/@iso-date) gt xs:date($now)

Message: The transaction value date must not be in the future.
Test (Xpath): value/@value-date and value/@value-date castable as xs:date and xs:date(value/@value-date) gt xs:date($now)

Message: The budget line value date must be in the budget period.
Test (Xpath): @value-date castable as xs:date and ../../period-start/@iso-date and ../../period-start/@iso-date castable as xs:date and ../../period-end/@iso-date and ../../period-end/@iso-date castable as xs:date and xs:date(@value-date) lt xs:date(../../period-start/@iso-date) or xs:date(@value-date) gt xs:date(../../period-end/@iso-date)

Message: The last-updated-datetime of the organisation must not be in the future.
Test (Xpath): @last-updated-datetime and @last-updated-datetime castable as xs:dateTime and xs:dateTime(@last-updated-datetime) gt $now

Message: The percentage must be between 0.0 and 100.0 (inclusive).
Test (Xpath): $iati-version = '2.03' and @percentage castable as xs:decimal and (xs:decimal(@percentage) lt 0 or xs:decimal(@percentage) gt 100)

Message: The percentage must be 0.0 or positive.
Test (Xpath): $iati-version ne '2.03' and @percentage castable as xs:decimal and xs:decimal(@percentage) lt 0

Message: The percentage must be between 0.0 and 100.0 (inclusive).
Test (Xpath): $iati-version = '2.03' and @percentage castable as xs:decimal and (xs:decimal(@percentage) lt 0 or xs:decimal(@percentage) gt 100)

Message: The percentage must be 0.0 or positive.
Test (Xpath): $iati-version ne '2.03' and @percentage castable as xs:decimal and xs:decimal(@percentage) lt 0

Message: The percentage must be between 0.0 and 100.0 (inclusive).
Test (Xpath): $iati-version = '2.03' and @percentage castable as xs:decimal and (xs:decimal(@percentage) lt 0 or xs:decimal(@percentage) gt 100)

Message: The percentage must be 0.0 or positive.
Test (Xpath): $iati-version ne '2.03' and @percentage castable as xs:decimal and xs:decimal(@percentage) lt 0

Message: The percentage must be a numerical value.
Percentages are missing for one or more sectors, within a vocabulary (e.g. 1 - OECD DAC).
Percentages for sectors, within a vocabulary (e.g. 1 - OECD DAC) must add up to 100%.
For a single sector, the percentage must either be omitted, or set to 100.
Test (Xpath): $group/@percentage and $group/@percentage castable as xs:decimal and xs:decimal($group/@percentage) !=100

Message: When using a reporting organisation sector code, it must include a narrative.
Percentages are missing for one or more recipient countries.
Percentages for recipient countries must add up to 100%.
For a single recipient country, the percentage must either be omitted, or set to 100.
Test (Xpath): $group/@percentage and $group/@percentage castable as xs:decimal and xs:decimal($group/@percentage) !=100

Message: Percentages are missing for one or more recipient countries or regions.
Percentages for recipient countries or regions must add up to 100%.
For a single recipient country or region, the percentage must either be omitted, or set to 100.
Test (Xpath): $group/@percentage and $group/@percentage castable as xs:decimal and xs:decimal($group/@percentage) !=100

Message: If the activity has recipient-country or recipient-region information, none of the transactions should have a recipient-country or recipient-region.
The activity should have recipient-country or recipient-region information for either the activity or for all transactions.
If transactions have a recipient-country or recipient-region, they must be used for all transactions.
The activity should specify a default language, or the language must be specified for each narrative element.
The title has no narrative content.
The description has no narrative content.
The organisation should specify a default language, or the language should be specified for each narrative element.
Document Link must have a specified language, or the Activity must have a default language.
The document format must be present.
The participating organisation must have an identifier or a narrative.
The activity must have a planned or actual start date.
When using a reporting organisation policy marker, it must include a narrative.
When using a policy marker for vocabulary 1, it must include a significance.
Document Link must have a specified language, or the Organisation must have a default language.
Activity Status must be present.
Each activity must have a specified Sector Classification, at either activity level, or for ALL transactions.
Organisation Type must be present.
Sectors are present at both the activity AND transaction level. Sectors should only be present at activity OR transaction level.
If transactions have a sector classification, they must be used for all transactions.
The owner organisation must have an identifier or a narrative.
The organisation must have an identifier or a narrative.
Budget Value must include a Value Date.
Budget Period must not be longer than one year.
The Value must have a specified Currency, or the Activity must have a default Currency.
Percentages are missing for one or more country budget items, within a vocabulary (e.g. 4 - Reporting Organisation).
Percentages for country budget items, within a vocabulary (e.g. 4 - Reporting Organisation) must add up to 100%.
For a single country budget item, the percentage must either be omitted, or set to 100.
Test (Xpath): $group/@percentage and $group/@percentage castable as xs:decimal and xs:decimal($group/@percentage) !=100

Message: The actual must have a value when indicator measure is unit (1), percentage (2), nominal (3) or ordinal (4).
The @value should be a valid number for all non-qualitative measures.
The @value should be omitted for qualitative measures.
If a result has a reference code, the indicator must not have a reference code.
